t: Psalm 34
A Psalm of David, when he changed his behaviour before Abimelech; who drove him away, and he departed.
I*p will bless the Lord*s at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
My*p soul shall make her boast in the Lord:*s the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.
O*p magnify the Lord*s with me, and let us exalt his name together.
I*p sought the Lord,*s and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
They*p looked unto him, and were lightened: and their faces were not ashamed.
This*p poor man cried, and the Lord*s heard him, and saved him out of all his troubles.
The*p angel of the Lord*s encampeth round about them that fear him, and delivereth them.
O*p taste and see that the Lord*s is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
O*p fear the Lord,*s ye his saints: for there is no want to them that fear him.
The*p young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the Lord*s shall not want any good thing.
Come,*p ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the Lord.*s
What*p man is he that desireth life, and loveth many days, that he may see good?
Keep*p thy tongue from evil, and thy lips from speaking guile.
Depart*p from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursue it.
The*p eyes of the Lord*s are upon the righteous, and his ears are open unto their cry.
The*p face of the Lord*s is against them that do evil, to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
The*p righteous cry, and the Lord*s heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
The*p Lord*s is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.
Many*p are the afflictions of the righteous: but the Lord*s delivereth him out of them all.
He*p keepeth all his bones: not one of them is broken.
Evil*p shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.
The*p Lord*s redeemeth the soul of his servants: and none of them that trust in him shall be desolate.
